Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-Rb (UCLL1; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 34.5 ug/ml), S. dysgalactiae (MIC 21.8 ug/ml), S. agalactiae (30.5 ug/ml), S. aureus PTCC 1431 (42.1 ug/ml), S. typhimurium PTCC 1428 (MIC 31.8 ug/ml), and K. pneumoniae (MIC 35.1 ug/ml).Chemical modification: Synthetic C-terminally amidated peptide is active against S. aureus (MIC 19.8 ug/ml), but poorly active against E.coli (MIC 248 ug/ml) and A.baumannii (MIC 248 ug/ml).Toxicity: The peptide showed a dose-deppendnet effect on bllod cells and about 1.1% hemolysis at 60 ug/ml.Chemical modification: Although not reported, the peptide is likely amidated at the C-terminus.Structure: Synthetic C-terminally amidated peptide is helical in the presence of 50% or 100% TFE or POPG (Lopes et al., 2022). Also provided by Ahmad Asoodeh.Updated 7/2021; 8/2022; 2/2023
Literature Information.Author: Asoodeh A, Zardini HZ, Chamani J.2011, Iran, Asia
Literature Information.Reference: J Pept Sci. 2012 Jan;18(1):10-6. doi: 10.1002/psc.1409. Epub 2011 Sep 29.PubMed.
Literature Information.Title: Identification and characterization of two novel antimicrobial peptides, temporin-Ra and temporin-Rb, from skin secretions of the marsh frog (Rana ridibunda)
